name: lint-for-cpp
description: An advanced, modern, static analysis extension for C/C++ that supports a number of back-end analyzer programs.

scripts.webpack: npm run clean && webpack --mode production --config ./client/webpack.config.js && webpack --mode production --config ./server/webpack.config.js
scripts.webpack:dev: npm run clean && webpack --mode none --config ./client/webpack.config.js && webpack --mode none --config ./server/webpack.config.js
scripts.compile: npm run compile:server && npm run compile:client && npm run compile:specs
scripts.lint: npm run lint:client && npm run lint:server && npm run lint:specs
scripts.clean: rimraf client/out && rimraf server/out && rimraf specs/out
scripts.test: npm run clean && npm run spec
scripts.postinstall: cd client && npm install && cd ../server && npm install && cd ..

commands.title: Lint for C++: Analyze the active document
Lint for C++: Analyze all documents opened in the workspace
Lint for C++: Reset Workspace State
commands.description: Reset keys in workspace state to undefined.

commands.title: Lint for C++: Toggle Workspace Trust Flag
commands.description: Toggle the workspace trust flag. Workspace settings that determine tool locations are disabled by default in untrusted workspaces.

lint-for-cpp.debug.description: Enable or disable verbose debug logging

lint-for-cpp.run.description: Run the linter upon typing (onType), upon a build task (onBuild), or upon file save (onSave).

lint-for-cpp.ignoreParseErrors.description: Ignore when the extension can't parse a line of the linter.

lint-for-cpp.excludeFromWorkspacePaths.description: A list of paths within the workspace for which no analyses/diagnostics will be displayed.

lint-for-cpp.language.description: Force to check all files as the given language. Cascades to all analyzers unless overridden in one or more analyzers.

lint-for-cpp.standard.description: The language standards to check against. Cascades to all analyzers unless overridden in one or more analyzers.

lint-for-cpp.defines.description: Preprocessor symbols to define. Cascades to all analyzers unless overridden in one or more analyzers. If not specified it uses "C_Cpp.default.defines" or "defines" from c_cpp_properties.json

lint-for-cpp.undefines.description: Preprocessor symbols to undefine. Cascades to all analyzers unless overridden in one or more analyzers.

lint-for-cpp.includePaths.description: Paths to search for include files. They may be relative or absolute. Cascades to all analyzers unless overridden in one or more analyzers. If not specified it uses "C_Cpp.default.includePath" or "includePath" from c_cpp_properties.json

lint-for-cpp.queryUrlBase.markdownDescription: This option allows you to chose your preferred search engine for diagnostic code lookup. See also `#lint-for-cpp.webQueryMatchSet#` to configure the keywords of the diagnostic code which will make it searchable on the web.

lint-for-cpp.webQueryMatchSet.markdownDescription: The diagnostic code match set for which a web lookup will be proposed. Web search engine can be customized through `#lint-for-cpp.queryUrlBase#`.

lint-for-cpp.clang.enable.description: Enable or disable the Clang linter

lint-for-cpp.clang.executable.description: This option allows you to override the executable called when using Clang

lint-for-cpp.clang.configFile.description: A .clang_complete file to use/fallback to if no config file is found in the current project

lint-for-cpp.clang.includePaths.description: Paths to search for include files. They may be relative or absolute. If not specified it falls back to "lint-for-cpp.includePaths"

lint-for-cpp.clang.standard.description: The language standards to check against. For example, one or more of: posix, c89, c99, c11, c17, c18, c++03, c++11, c++14, c++17, c++20.

lint-for-cpp.clang.defines.description: Preprocessor symbols to define. If not specified it falls back to "lint-for-cpp.defines"

lint-for-cpp.clang.language.description: Force Clang to check all files as the given language.

lint-for-cpp.clang.extraArgs.description: Extra verbatim command-line arguments to include on the Clang command-line invocation.

lint-for-cpp.clang.warnings.description: Warnings to include in the analysis. Default is everything possible.

lint-for-cpp.clang.includes.description: An array of files to directly include with every processed file. Operates via utilizing Clang's -include parameter.

lint-for-cpp.clang.standardLibs.description: The standard libraries to utilize. Operates via utilizing Clang's -stdlib parameter. Some macOS and BSD systems need to use a special library for C++11 support.

lint-for-cpp.clang.pedantic.description: Enable or disable the -pedantic command-line argument to Clang.

lint-for-cpp.clang.pedanticErrors.description: Enable or disable the -pedantic-errors command-line argument to Clang.

lint-for-cpp.clang.msExtensions.description: Enable or disable the -fms-extensions command-line argument to Clang.

lint-for-cpp.clang.noExceptions.description: Enable or disable the -fno-exceptions command-line argument to Clang.

lint-for-cpp.clang.noRtti.description: Enable or disable the -fno-rtti command-line argument to Clang.

lint-for-cpp.clang.blocks.description: Enable or disable the -fblocks command-line argument to Clang.

lint-for-cpp.clang.severityLevels.description: Maps the severity levels of Clang to VSCode severity levels (Error, Warning, Information, Hint). Setting to 'None' will not show the severity type at all.

fatal.description: Used when very major issues are found.

error.description: Used when major issues are found.

warning.description: Suggestions about defensive programming to prevent potential issues.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.enable.description: Enable or disable the CppCheck linter

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.executable.description: This option allows you to override the executable called when using CppCheck

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.extraArgs.description: Extra verbatim command-line arguments to include on the cppcheck command-line invocation.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.configFile.description: A .clang_complete file to use/fallback to if no config file is found in the current project

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.includePaths.description: Paths to search for include files. They may be relative or absolute. If not specified it falls back to "lint-for-cpp.includePaths"

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.platform.description: The platform used for types and sizes.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.standard.description: The language standards to check against. Can be one or more of: posix, c89, c99, c11, c17, c18, c++03, c++11, c++14, c++17, c++20.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.defines.description: Preprocessor symbols to define. If not specified it falls back to "lint-for-cpp.defines"

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.suppressions.description: Warnings to suppress. Refer to the CppCheck documentation for what to supply here.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.addons.description: Addons to use with cppcheck. For example, misra, cert, etc. Refer to the CppCheck documentation for what to supply here.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.verbose.description: Whether to enable verbose output from CppCheck.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.language.description: Force CppCheck to check all files as the given language.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.inconclusive.description: Allow reporting even though analysis is inconclusive. May lead to false positives.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.force.description: Controls whether CppCheck enumerates all possible configurations.

lint-for-cpp.cppcheck.severityLevels.description: Maps the severity levels of CppCheck to VSCode severity levels (Error, Warning, Information, Hint). Setting to 'None' will not show the severity type at all.

error.description: Used when major issues are found.

warning.description: Suggestions about defensive programming to prevent potential issues.

style.description: Stylistic issues related to code cleanup such as unused functions, redundant code, constness, etc.

performance.description: Suggestions for making the code faster. These suggestions only and may not increase execution speed.

information.description: Minor issues that do not fit into other categories.

lint-for-cpp.flexelint.enable.description: Enable or disable the Flexelint linter

lint-for-cpp.flexelint.executable.description: This option allows you to override the executable called when using Flexelint

lint-for-cpp.flexelint.configFile.description: A .flexelint.rc file to use/fallback to if no config file is found in the current project

lint-for-cpp.flexelint.headerArgs.description: A list of arguments passed to Flexelint when scanning header source files

lint-for-cpp.flexelint.severityLevels.description: Maps the severity levels of Flexelint to VSCode severity levels (Error, Warning, Information, Hint). Setting to 'None' will not show the severity type at all.

Error.description: Used when major issues are found.

Warning.description: Suggestions about defensive programming to prevent potential issues.

lint-for-cpp.pclintplus.enable.description: Enable or disable the PC-lint Plus linter

lint-for-cpp.pclintplus.executable.description: This option allows you to override the executable called when using PC-lint Plus

lint-for-cpp.pclintplus.configFile.description: A PC-lint Plus file to use/fallback to if no config file is found in the current project

lint-for-cpp.pclintplus.headerArgs.description: A list of arguments passed to PC-lint Plus when scanning header source files

lint-for-cpp.pclintplus.severityLevels.description: Maps the severity levels of PC-lint Plus to VSCode severity levels (Error, Warning, Information, Hint). Setting to 'None' will not show the severity type at all.

error.description: Used when major issues are found.

warning.description: Suggestions about defensive programming to prevent potential issues.

lint-for-cpp.flawfinder.enable.description: Enable or disable the FlawFinder linter

lint-for-cpp.flawfinder.executable.description: This option allows you to override the executable called when using FlawFinder

lint-for-cpp.flawfinder.severityLevels.description: Maps the severity levels of CppCheck to VSCode severity levels (Error, Warning, Information, Hint). Setting to 'None' will not show the severity type at all.

0.description: Used when lv 0 issues are found.

1.description: Used when lv 1 issues are found.

2.description: Used when lv 2 issues are found.

3.description: Used when lv 3 issues are found.

4.description: Used when lv 4 issues are found.

5.description: Used when lv 5 issues are found.

lint-for-cpp.lizard.enable.description: Enable or disable the lizard linter

lint-for-cpp.lizard.executable.description: This option allows you to override the executable called when using lizard

lint-for-cpp.lizard.extraArgs.description: Extra verbatim command-line arguments to include on the lizard command-line invocation.
